data.title: Great pizza!
data.text: I love their pizza, and now that in gluten and lactose intolerant, I can still partake by bringing a gluten free crust and have them leave off the cheese.  It's still as yummy as it always has been!

owner_response.author: Loyd T, Owner at Orlando’s Italian Restaurant, responded to this review
owner_response.text: That's innovative, bringing in your own crust! We looked at providing gluten free pizza and pasta but given the scale and volume of our restaurants we were very concerned we would slip up and get flour on the GF products. I'm glad we were able to accommodate you. I know it is tough being GF and lactose free!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Waited 1hr. For salads!
data.text: We had lunch here and 2 ordered salads, 1 ordered minestrone soup, one had cheese soup & salad and one ordered cheese ravioli. We waited over an hour to receive our food. The waiter was very apologetic but for some reason the kitchen staff just could not get out 3 salads, 2 bowls of soup and cheese raivioli. They lost the order of ravioli and we did not get it until time to leave, one and a half hours later! The. They did not even comp her food but just charged her $4! Food was good but we will never go again! It was a waste of our time!

owner_response.author: Loyd T, Owner at Orlando’s Italian Restaurant, responded to this review
owner_response.text: I am sorry that you had such a poor experience. It's not our norm.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Mafia Queso, yum!!
data.text: Great Italian food choices plus a few extras. The mafia Queso is fantastic and the blue cheese dressing for my salad is always the best I get anywhere. Pizza, and pasta are always tasty.

owner_response.author: Loyd T, Owner at Orlando’s Italian Restaurant, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Every once in a while we get a complaint that our blue cheese dressing is not "real" blue cheese dressing, but 99% of the comments love the blue cheese crumbles that are visible. Hard to please everyone, but I am glad we pleased you! Thanks for taking the time to write such a nice review, and come back soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: What good food!
data.text: OH, my.  We ate here two nights in a row.  The first night the food and the service were so superb we decided to go back again.  The second night the food and service were just as good.  What a delightful treat.  We split an entree each night, got an extra salad, had garlic bread (delicious) and had a bottle of wine.  Price was right, service was excellent, and the food was outstanding.  Do not miss this!!!

owner_response.author: Loyd T, Owner at Orlando’s Italian Restaurant, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for the compliments! We try very hard to create a nice place to go. We've been in Lubbock 50 years, but we never take anyone's business for granted. We live here too! Next time try the Green Chile Chicken Pizza! Yum!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Delizioso!!
data.text: One of our most favorite places to dine in Lubbock.  Quaint little place, great food, wine, and outstanding staff.  The Italian decor adds to the ambience of this restaurant.  Whenever family and friends visit from out of town they always request that we add Orlando's as one of the dining choices wile they are here in Lubbock.

owner_response.author: Loyd T, Owner at Orlando’s Italian Restaurant, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We're 50 years old but we never rest on our laurels, we just keep trying to provide a nice place to go for the Lubbock locals, and those who wander in from afar. This is my favorite "unofficial" saying--"Orlando's, Nowhere else on Earth." Thanks for the nice review!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Sometimes too much is just that, too much
data.text:
Let me start by saying if I could give it a 3.5, I would, but I could not justify a 4...

Family owned and uber popular Itlian style eatery, Orlando's I always assumed was a Mexican restaurant, until i went inside one day. Here ar ethe highlights:

Staff, young but incredibly polite. Most have probably been eating there for years and took on a job to supplement school.

You feel as if you are in a carnival ride or something with the whirling noise and bustle of people coming and going. But thats not a bad thing, as long as you are prepared for it.

Delivery is always prompt and hot. A solid combo.

Now, for some of the issues that could revitalize and make this place that one step better:

Updates. The interiors are dated, walls are greasy and carpets are worn in the Indian location. Ave Q location is a bitt cleaner and probably had a renovation not that many years ago.

Size of the table and chairs. Being a larger than average structure, sitting in your booths isn't possible. The chairs I don't feel will pass the "Bryan" test.

Food. Now here is the kicker. I think it is way over seasoned. Let the natural flavors of tomato and garlic gently come through, don't heavy fist it with every seasoning in the kitchen. Cheese? Just the eight amount for Lasagnas and pasta dishes topped with gooey quality mozzarella. Back away from the salt. Back away from the basil/oregano/parsley, etc and let the quality produce shine through.

All in all, parking is plentiful at both locations. All of the above applies to both locations. And yes, I will be back again.

owner_response.author: Loyd T, Owner at Orlando’s Italian Restaurant, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Bryan, you are right about the booths. They were built in a time when people were smaller. As for the chairs, those are very sturdy and have wide seats, so I think you are OK there. They are stronger than they look. You are right about the carpet at Orlando's Indiana, and we will address that soon. Thanks for coming in!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Delicious!!!!!!
data.text: We got this delivered and it was a delicious surprise!!! Much better than expected!!! I highly recommend this place!!!!

owner_response.author: Loyd T, Owner at Orlando’s Italian Restaurant, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for giving Orlando's a try! Most customers really like our food, or we would not have lasted for over 50 years! We appreciate the kind words.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Carb laden
data.text: Most dishes are full of carbs and limited meat, fish or poultry options. IF you are looking for a pizza, this place might be okay but not for decent Italian food.

owner_response.author: Loyd T, Owner at Orlando’s Italian Restaurant, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Most of our pasta dishes are able to be served with mixed vegetables instead of the pasta part. A LOT of our customers are able to eat low carb with us. The Meat Lover's Salad is a very popular summer choice. But if pizza is all you can find that you like at our places, come in for that!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Delicious Meal
data.text: We enjoyed our visit to Orlando's and were impressed by how affordable it was. They had a decent wine list and I loved the Eggplant Parmesan. I can recommend the restaurant without hesitation, and next time I'm in Lubbock will go again.

owner_response.author: Loyd T, Owner at Orlando’s Italian Restaurant, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for stopping by! I hope you enjoyed your stay in Lubbock. Come back soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Basic Italian
data.text: Orlando's is a charming Italian restaurant near downtown Lubbock.  Overall, I enjoyed my meal here and had good service.  The pasta dishes come with soup or salad and garlic bread.  The bread is quite good.  The spaghetti I had was good, they do charge extra for meatballs.  I wasn't crazy about the sauce though.  It was a bit watery and not my most favorite.  The sauce was the same on the veal dish we ordered as well.

owner_response.author: Loyd T, Owner at Orlando’s Italian Restaurant, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for the review! We've had issues with the tomatoes breaking down in the sauce. lately. The supplier blames the pack from the manufacturers. We tried several different brands but nothing fixed it. Next time try the Alfredo sauce--no water in it just good 'ol fat! lol Come back soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Huge servings
data.text: We've eaten here on most of our trips thru Lubbock. This time I had the half order of cheese ravioli. I thought the server had brought the full! There were about 9 huge pillows. My husband had a 10" pizza 🍕It would have been perfect for one except he ate some of my ravioli. Decent salad. Amazing garlic bread. Good service.

owner_response.author: Loyd T, Owner at Orlando’s Italian Restaurant, responded to this review
owner_response.text: You come back anytime! Thanks for taking the time to write a nice review!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Close to Downtown and Great Food
data.text: Always a good place to take clients or out-of-town visitors for lunch.  Great Italian food and service.  Full bar and wine menu.  Some of the booths are "private" with louvered french doors and are great for that romantic evening meal with wine.  This is one of the long-time established Lubbock places.  And if you like hot wings, amazingly enough, they have the best I've ever eaten (I like 'em hot and dry).

owner_response.author: Loyd T, Owner at Orlando’s Italian Restaurant, responded to this review
owner_response.text: I agree with you. I think our wings are every bit as good as some wing places. I like mine dry too, but I will eat our Down and Dirty with Habanero Garlic Butter on them sometimes. Now my mouth is watering! Oddly enough we won Texas Monthly #10 burger  in Texas with our Cheeseburger in Paradise! lol Thanks for the review! Loyd
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Take out/delivery
data.text: My husband and I ordered the pasta special delivered to our hotel. Delicious! It came quickly, piping hot, complete with paper plates and utensils. The special had ravioli, spaghetti,  cannelloni, and tortellini. Great meat sauce, bread, and salad, too.  Next pass thru Lubbock we will have to eat at the restaurant.

owner_response.author: Loyd T, Owner at Orlando’s Italian Restaurant, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for stopping by and giving us such nice compliments! We sure try! Loyd
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great Lunch Spot
data.text: Tucked away from the busy part of town is a real gem. Orlando's is a great lunch spot. Burger are almost too big to eat in one sitting. Staff is very good.

owner_response.author: Loyd T, Owner at Orlando’s Italian Restaurant, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for the nice review! We've satisfied the downtown crowd's appetite for over 50 years now! Come back soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great as usual.
data.text: Had a family dinner and tried some new stuff.  fried ravioli was good but too much zucchini on the appetizer plate.  Roast beef was great as usual, pizza and lasagna were wonderful

owner_response.author: Loyd T, Owner at Orlando’s Italian Restaurant, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for the nice review! That Jumbo Roast Beef sandwich is hard to beat! Good winter fare! Happy New Year! Loyd
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Comfy place for Italian
data.text: Consistent with their menu and flavors. The Ave. Q restaurant is more cozy than the one on Indiana Ave., but the selections are the same.

owner_response.author: Loyd T, Owner at Orlando’s Italian Restaurant, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for taking the time to write a review! Ave. Q is the most cozy place in town i think! Loyd
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: "Go To Restaurant after a Texas Tech football game"
data.text: Orlando's is always our meeting place for friends after a Texas Tech football game when in town. So consistent! This trip had the chicken dijon, very tasty, a little spicy and excellent dinner dish. Service was excellent during our Halloween visit this year. Wait staff were in a costume contest allowing the dining to be more lively this night. Downtown location easy to get to after a ball game too.

owner_response.author: Loyd T, Owner at Orlando’s Italian Restaurant, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for taking the time to write such a nice review!  Loyd L. Turner, President, Orlando's Enterprises, Inc.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Its just not what it used to be.
data.text: The service was minimal.  When we finally received our order is was warm verging on being cold.   This used to be one of the best in town.   We will not visit this location again for a long while if at all.

owner_response.author: Loyd T, Owner at Orlando’s Italian Restaurant, responded to this review
owner_response.text: I am sorry we did not shine when you came in. We try hard, but we sometimes miss the mark. I always pass on the misses to the management staff at that location and they use them for training points, so thanks for taking the time to let us know we need to do better!  Loyd L. Turner, President, Orlando's Enterprises, Inc.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Good to a point....
data.text: Orlando's has good Italian food, and this would be a great review except for one small problem.  Our party of five ordered their food, and it all arrived very quickly at our table, with the exception of my wife's order which was a gluten free Shrimp Florentine on brown rice.  It was delivered about 5-10 minutes, after the rest of our meals.  After waiting this time it was delivered with the wrong sauce.   I went to find our waiter, did not see him so asked one of the other waiters to please send him to our table.  Again, a short wait, and another waiter appeared asked what was the problem, we explained and he indicated he would find our waiter and tell him.   A full 15 minutes later the new dish arrived.  We should have tracked down the manager but could not find them either, the wife had a few bites and when our waiter appeared we asked for to go  boxes so that we would not keep the rest of the party waiting.  We left the restaurant.  The next day, I suggested that the wife try to finish off the leftovers, she indicated that they did not taste right, and that was another reason she didn't finish them the night before.   I tried them, and indeed they were very spicy (not sure that Florentine is spicy), and wonder if we had made someone mad in the kitchen or on the wait staff.  Any way, this ruined what could have been a very nice dining experience.  I have always felt that "you only have one chance to make a first impression", so will probably never go back to this restaurant.  They can do something's right or they would not have been in business for 50 years, so good luck to all that go to eat at this restaurant.

owner_response.author: Loyd T, Owner at Orlando’s Italian Restaurant, responded to this review
owner_response.text: I am sorry your first experience was so bad. It sounds like we failed multiple times. Not our norm. We do not have a dish called Shrimp Florentine on the menu, so I am not sure what you got. If you got something spicy, it was probably Sizzle Shrimp, which is very spicy. We also have pesto with shrimp, which would have been green, but not hot. We also have shrimp caldo, which is a spicy tomato sauce. I'm pretty sure nothing was done out of spite, as we get special requests all day long, and in our 50 years of serving customers, we have seen it all. Please give us another chance to impress! I apologize our manager was not there to take control. Loyd L. Turner, President, Orlando's Enterprises, Inc.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Our Go-To restaurant for 30 years!
data.text: Orlando's is a locally owned family style Italian restaurant that we have been going to for the last 30 years.  We prefer the original location on Ave Q.  The food is consistently good as well as the service.  The green chili chicken linguini is a favorite among family and friends.  We now get lazy and have our dinner delivered for a nominal fee!  So have a full meal and be stuffed or a salad with to die for blue cheese dressing.  So visitors to Lubbock, don't go to a chain restaurant you can eat at anywhere, try a Lubbock original, Orlando's.

owner_response.author: Loyd T, Owner at Orlando’s Italian Restaurant, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for taking the time to write such a nice review! We appreciate your three decades of business! It's customers like you that make us great! Loyd L. Turner, President, Orlando's Enterprises, Inc.
owner_response.title: Owner Response
